query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 S’ïo avessi le rime aspre e chiocce, 2 come si converrebbe al tristo buco 3 sovra ’l qual pontan tutte l’altre rocce,
query.result: 1 If I had the harsh and hoarse rhymes, 2 as would befit the dismal hole 3 over which all the other rocks jut out,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
4 io premerei di mio concetto il suco 5 più pienamente; ma perch’ io non l’abbo, 6 non sanza tema a dicer mi conduco;

Please translate each line literally into English.
7 ché non è impresa da pigliare a gabbo 8 discriver fondo a tutto l’universo, 9 né da lingua che chiami mamma o babbo.
query.result: 7 for it is no enterprise to be taken lightly 8 to describe the bottom of the entire universe, 9 nor for a tongue that calls for mother or father.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
10 Ma quelle donne aiutino il mio verso 11 ch’aiutaro Anfïone a chiuder Tebe, 12 sì che dal fatto il dir non sia diverso.
query.result: 10 But may those ladies help my verse 11 who helped Amphion to enclose Thebes, 12 so that the telling may not be different from the deed.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
13 Oh sovra tutte mal creata plebe 14 che stai nel loco onde parlare è duro, 15 mei foste state qui pecore o zebe!
query.result: 13 Oh, you people created worse than all evil, 14 who are in the place from which it is hard to speak, 15 I wish you had been sheep or goats here!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
16 Come noi fummo giù nel pozzo scuro 17 sotto i piè del gigante assai più bassi, 18 e io mirava ancora a l’alto muro,
query.result: 16 When we were down in the dark pit, 17 much lower than the giant’s feet, 18 and I was still looking at the high wall,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
19 dicere udi’mi: «Guarda come passi: 20 va sì, che tu non calchi con le piante 21 le teste de’ fratei miseri lassi».
query.result: 19 I heard someone say to me: “Watch how you step: 20 go so that you do not tread with your soles 21 on the heads of your wretched, weary brothers.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
22 Per ch’io mi volsi, e vidimi davante 23 e sotto i piedi un lago che per gelo 24 avea di vetro e non d’acqua sembiante.
query.result: 22 Whereupon I turned and saw before me 23 and under my feet a lake which, because of the frost, 24 had the appearance of glass and not of water.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
25 Non fece al corso suo sì grosso velo 26 di verno la Danoia in Osterlicchi, 27 né Tanaï là sotto ’l freddo cielo,
query.result: 25 The Danube in Austria did not make so thick a veil 26 of itself in its course during winter, 27 nor the Don under the cold sky,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
28 com’ era quivi; che se Tambernicchi 29 vi fosse sù caduto, o Pietrapana, 30 non avria pur da l’orlo fatto cricchi.
query.result: 28 as was there; for if Mount Tambura 29 or Mount Pietrapana had fallen on it, 30 it would not have made so much as a crack at the edge.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
31 E come a gracidar si sta la rana 32 col muso fuor de l’acqua, quando sogna 33 di spigolar sovente la villana,
query.result: 31 And as the frog sits croaking 32 with its snout out of the water, when the countrywoman dreams 33 of gleaning often,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
34 livide, insin là dove appar vergogna 35 eran l’ombre dolenti ne la ghiaccia, 36 mettendo i denti in nota di cicogna.
query.result: 34 livid, up to where shame appears, 35 were the woeful shades in the ice, 36 chattering their teeth like storks.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
37 Ognuna in giù tenea volta la faccia; 38 da bocca il freddo, e da li occhi il cor tristo 39 tra lor testimonianza si procaccia.

Please translate each line literally into English.
40 Quand’ io m’ebbi dintorno alquanto visto, 41 volsimi a’ piedi, e vidi due sì stretti, 42 che ’l pel del capo avieno insieme misto.
query.result: 40 When I had looked around me for a while, 41 I turned to my feet and saw two so close together, 42 that the hair on their heads was mingled together.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
43 «Ditemi, voi che sì strignete i petti», 44 diss’ io, «chi siete?». E quei piegaro i colli; 45 e poi ch’ebber li visi a me eretti,

Please translate each line literally into English.
46 li occhi lor, ch’eran pria pur dentro molli, 47 gocciar su per le labbra, e ’l gelo strinse 48 le lagrime tra essi e riserrolli.
query.result: 46 their eyes, which were previously soft within, 47 dripped down over their lips, and the frost 48 congealed the tears between them and sealed them shut.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
49 Con legno legno spranga mai non cinse 50 forte così; ond’ ei come due becchi 51 cozzaro insieme, tanta ira li vinse.
query.result: 49 Never did a carpenter encircle wood with wood 50 so tightly; wherefore they, like two billy goats, 51 butted heads together, so much anger overcame them.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
52 E un ch’avea perduti ambo li orecchi 53 per la freddura, pur col viso in giùe, 54 disse: «Perché cotanto in noi ti specchi?
query.result: 52 And one who had lost both his ears 53 because of the cold, still with his face down, 54 said: “Why do you mirror yourself in us so much?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
55 Se vuoi saper chi son cotesti due, 56 la valle onde Bisenzo si dichina 57 del padre loro Alberto e di lor fue.
query.result: 55 If you want to know who these two are, 56 the valley from which the Bisenzio descends 57 was theirs and their father Alberto’s.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.

67 E perché non mi metti in più sermoni, 68 sappi ch’i’ fu’ il Camiscion de’ Pazzi; 69 e aspetto Carlin che mi scagioni».

Please translate each line literally into English.
70 Poscia vid’ io mille visi cagnazzi 71 fatti per freddo; onde mi vien riprezzo, 72 e verrà sempre, de’ gelati guazzi.
query.result: 70 Then I saw a thousand doglike faces 71 made by the cold; from which I am seized with dread, 72 and will always be, of the frozen puddles.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
73 E mentre ch’andavamo inver’ lo mezzo 74 al quale ogne gravezza si rauna, 75 e io tremava ne l’etterno rezzo;

76 se voler fu o destino o fortuna, 77 non so; ma, passeggiando tra le teste, 78 forte percossi ’l piè nel viso ad una.
query.result: 76 whether it was will or destiny or chance, 77 I do not know; but, walking among the heads, 78 I struck my foot hard against the face of one.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
79 Piangendo mi sgridò: «Perché mi peste? 80 se tu non vieni a crescer la vendetta 81 di Montaperti, perché mi moleste?».
query.result: 79 Weeping, it scolded me: “Why do you trample on me? 80 If you do not come to increase the vengeance 81 of Montaperti, why do you bother me?”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
82 E io: «Maestro mio, or qui m’aspetta, 83 sì ch’io esca d’un dubbio per costui; 84 poi mi farai, quantunque vorrai, fretta».

85 Lo duca stette, e io dissi a colui 86 che bestemmiava duramente ancora: 87 «Qual se’ tu che così rampogni altrui?».
query.result: 85 The leader stopped, and I said to the one 86 who was still blaspheming harshly: 87 “Who are you that rebukes others so?”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.

query.result: 88 “Now who are you who go through Antenora, 89 striking others’ cheeks,” he replied, 90 “so that, if you were alive, it would be too much?”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.

query.result: 91 “I am alive, and it could be dear to you,” 92 was my reply, “if you ask for fame, 93 that I may place your name among the other notes.”
